app.title: Supa Moonbase (smoonb)
app.tagline: Backup and restore: complete and simple, as it should be
help.footer: Use "{cmd} help [command]" for more information about a command.
help.commands.backup: Create a full backup of your Supabase project
help.commands.restore: Restore a full backup (interactive mode with psql)
help.commands.import: Import a Dashboard backup and prepare the structure for restore
import.start: Preparing directory structure for the imported backup...
import.invalidFileName: Backup file name is not in the expected Dashboard format
import.nextStep: Next step: Run 'npx smoonb restore' to restore this backup
docker.instructions: To create a full backup of Supabase, you need to:
docker.tip: Tip: Docker Desktop must be running in the background
docker.required: Docker Desktop is required for full Supabase backup
docker.requiredComponents:
Docker Desktop is required for full Supabase backup
   - PostgreSQL Database
   - Edge Functions
   - All components via Supabase CLI
docker.installComponents: Install the required components and try again
supabase.installInstructions: To create a full backup of Supabase, you need to:
supabase.required: Supabase CLI is required for full Supabase backup
supabase.requiredComponents:
Supabase CLI is required for full Supabase backup
   - PostgreSQL Database
   - Edge Functions
   - All components via Docker
supabase.cliVersionPolicy: Version policy: accepts any version up to 1 minor behind the latest (same major). Use --skip-supabase-version-check to bypass the check.
supabase.cliUpdateRecommended: Supabase CLI {version} detected. We recommend always using the latest version for new features and bug fixes: https://supabase.com/docs/guides/cli/getting-started#updating-the-supabase-cli
supabase.cliOutdated: Supabase CLI {version} is below the minimum accepted version ({minVersion}). Latest: {latest}. Update to at least version {minVersion}.
supabase.cliVersionSkipWarning: Supabase CLI version check disabled (--skip-supabase-version-check). Proceeding without version check — user assumes the risk.
supabase.cliUpdateInstructions: Update the Supabase CLI and run smoonb again:
supabase.cliLatestUnknown: Could not fetch the latest Supabase CLI version. Cannot continue.
config.title: smoonb Configuration...
functions.moreOptions: For more options, use Supabase CLI directly:
disclaimer.title: Universal Disclaimer / Legal Notice
disclaimer.text: By continuing, you acknowledge and agree that Supa Moonbase (smoonb) is provided "AS IS" and "AS AVAILABLE", with no warranties of any kind—express, implied, or statutory—including but not limited to merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, and non-infringement, to the maximum extent permitted by applicable law. Backup and restore operations inherently carry risk, environments vary widely, and we cannot foresee or validate all user setups. You are solely responsible for validating your own environment, keeping independent copies, and verifying results before relying on them in production. We build Supa Moonbase (smoonb) on public, auditable, open-source repositories to help people simplify their workflows, but this does not create any warranty, promise of support, or service-level commitment.
disclaimer.limitation: Limitation of liability — To the maximum extent permitted by law, Goalmoon Tecnologia LTDA, its contributors, and licensors will not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, exemplary, or punitive damages (including loss of data, interruption of business, or lost profits) arising from or related to the use of, inability to use, backup/restore operations performed by, or results produced by Supa Moonbase (smoonb). Terms of Use: https://www.smoonb.com/terms. Privacy Policy: https://www.smoonb.com/privacy.
disclaimer.acceptBackup: Do you accept the Terms of Use and Risk Warning for Backup?
disclaimer.acceptRestore: Do you accept the Terms of Use and Risk Warning for Restore?
disclaimer.acceptImport: Do you accept the Terms of Use and Risk Warning for Import?
consent.title: The smoonb will read and write the .env.local file locally.
consent.backup: An automatic backup of .env.local will be created before any changes.
consent.mapping: We will map your environment variables to ensure all required keys are present and have the correct values for the target project.
help.configurationDesc: Configure .env.local with Supabase credentials and SMOONB_LICENSE_KEY (required). License: paste from desktop app at https://www.smoonb.com. Optional: SMOONB_TELEMETRY_ENABLED (default true), SMOONB_OUTPUT_DIR. smoonb maps variables interactively on first run.
help.backupTitle: 1. BACKUP - Create full backup of project:
help.backupExample1Desc: # Interactive process that captures all Supabase components
help.backupExample2Desc: # Skips interactive capture of Realtime Settings
help.restoreTitle: 2. RESTORE - Restore backup to a project:
help.restoreExample1Desc: # Interactive process that lists available backups and allows selection
help.restoreExample2Desc: # Imports and restores backup file directly (skips selection)
help.restoreExample3Desc: # Imports and restores backup and storage together
help.importTitle: 3. IMPORT - Import backup from Supabase Dashboard:
help.importExample2Desc: # Imports database and storage together (storage is optional)
help.checkExample1Desc: # Verifies connection, extensions, tables, RLS, Realtime and Storage
help.tip1: • The import command requires a backup file (.backup.gz), but storage (.storage.zip) is optional
help.tip2: • Storage depends on a backup, but backup does not depend on storage
help.tip3: • Use absolute or relative paths for files in the import command
help.tip4: • Backup file format must be: db_cluster-DD-MM-YYYY@HH-MM-SS.backup.gz
help.commands.backupDesc: Create a full backup of your Supabase project using Supabase CLI
help.commands.skipSupabaseVersionCheck: Skip the Supabase CLI version check (user assumes the risk)
help.commands.backupSkipRealtime: Skip interactive capture of Realtime Settings
help.commands.backupPostgresMajor: Postgres major version for dump (15, 17). Non-interactive; no menu.
help.commands.backupExample3Desc: # Skips Supabase CLI version check (use when your package manager lags behind, e.g. Scoop)
help.commands.backupPostgresMajorEnv: Required for backup and restore: SUPABASE_POSTGRES_MAJOR=15 or 17 (in .env.local or environment).
help.commands.backupPostgresVersionInDas: Where to find the Postgres version (Supabase Dashboard)
Project Settings -> Infrastructure -> Service Versions (Postgres line). Use that major for SUPABASE_POSTGRES_MAJOR.
help.commands.backupFlow5: 5. Environment variable mapping (license not in wizard)
help.commands.restoreDesc: Restore a full backup using psql (interactive mode)
help.commands.restoreFile: Full path of .backup.gz file to import and restore (optional)
help.commands.restoreStorage: Full path of .storage.zip file to import with backup (optional)
help.commands.restoreExample1Desc: # Interactive process that lists available backups
help.commands.restoreExample2Desc: # Imports and restores backup file directly
help.commands.restoreExample3Desc: # Imports and restores backup and storage together
help.commands.restoreExample4Desc: # Skips Supabase CLI version check (use when your package manager lags behind, e.g. Scoop)
help.commands.restoreFlow9: 9. Disclaimer: expected errors during restore (Supabase doc link); wait for completion, then test result
help.commands.restoreWhenFile1: • Automatically imports backup file before restoring
help.commands.restoreWhenFile3: • If --storage provided, also imports storage file
help.commands.restoreWhenFile4: • Useful for restoring backups downloaded directly from Dashboard
help.commands.checkDesc: Verify Supabase project integrity after restore
help.commands.checkExample1Desc: # Verifies integrity and displays report in console
help.commands.importDesc: Import .backup.gz file and optionally .storage.zip from Supabase Dashboard
help.commands.importFile: Full path of .backup.gz file to import
help.commands.importStorage: Full path of .storage.zip file to import (optional)
help.commands.importImportant2: • Storage file is optional and depends on a backup
help.commands.importImportant3: • Both files will be copied to the same backup folder
help.commands.importImportant4: • Imported backup will be available for restore command
quickHelp.title: MAIN COMMANDS:
quickHelp.backupDesc: npx smoonb backup                    # Full interactive backup using Docker
quickHelp.restoreDesc: npx smoonb restore                    # Interactive restoration using psql (Docker)
quickHelp.checkDesc: npx smoonb check                     # Verifies project integrity
quickHelp.configurationDesc: Configure the .env.local file in the project root with your Supabase credentials. The smoonb will map variables interactively on first execution.
quickHelp.tokenDesc: For Management API (Edge Functions, Auth Settings, Storage):
docker.validation.title: Docker Validation
license.promptPaste: Paste the license key from the desktop app:
license.validationUnavailable: Could not validate your license right now.
license.checkConnection: Check your connection and try again.
license.invalidOrInactive: Your license is invalid or your subscription is not active.
license.openDesktopApp: Open the desktop app, check your subscription and generate a new license.
license.denied.title: License validation denied by server.
license.denied.alreadyBound: This license is already linked to another machine and cannot be moved.
license.denied.alreadyBoundAction: To use smoonb on this machine, revoke this license in the desktop app and generate a new one: {url}
license.trialNotice: You are using a trial license.
license.error.title: License validation failed.
license.error.typeParse: Type: Unexpected response format from API
license.error.supportStep5: Paste the diagnostic bundle below and send
license.error.messageSuggestion: Message: "I'm unable to validate my license in the CLI. Here is the diagnostic bundle:" then paste the bundle below.
env.licenseKey.help: Paste the license generated in the desktop app.
env.telemetry.help: Set to false to disable telemetry (default: true).
env.supabasePostgresMajor.hintTitle: How to check the Postgres version in Supabase
env.supabasePostgresMajor.hintBody: Check the Postgres line and use the major (e.g. 15 or 17) for SUPABASE_POSTGRES_MAJOR.
env.mapping.title: Mapping variable: {variable}
env.mapping.addNew: Add a new key for me
env.mapping.isCorrect: Is this the correct value for the target project?
env.mapping.fileNotFound: .env.local file not found. It will be created during mapping.
env.mapping.updated: .env.local updated successfully. No keys renamed; values synchronized.
env.language.note: Note: The language change will be effective in the next commands. The current process will continue in the initial language.
backup.components.edgeFunctions.title: Edge Functions:
backup.components.edgeFunctions.descript: We will delete existing functions in the supabase/functions folder, reset the link
between the tool and the project, and download functions from the server again.
You will have the option to keep or delete functions in the folder after backup.
backup.components.edgeFunctions.include: Do you want to include Edge Functions
backup.components.edgeFunctions.cleanup: Do you want to clean supabase/functions after backup
backup.components.temp.title: Supabase .temp:
backup.components.temp.description1: We will copy existing files (if any) in the supabase/.temp folder.
backup.components.temp.description2: You will have the option to keep or delete files in this folder after backup.
backup.components.temp.include: Do you want to include Supabase .temp
backup.components.temp.cleanup: Do you want to delete supabase/.temp after backup
backup.components.migrations.title: Migrations:
backup.components.migrations.description: We will delete existing migrations (if any) in the supabase/migrations folder,
reset the link between the tool and the project, and download migrations
from the server again. You will have the option to keep or delete migrations in the folder after backup.
backup.components.migrations.include: Do you want to include Migrations
backup.components.migrations.cleanup: Do you want to delete supabase/migrations after backup
backup.components.storage.include: Do you want to include Storage
backup.components.auth.include: Do you want to include Auth
backup.components.realtime.include: Do you want to include Realtime

backup.complete.title: FULL BACKUP COMPLETED VIA DOCKER!

backup.complete.roles: Custom Roles: {count} roles exported via SQL

backup.error.databaseUrlInstructions: To create a full backup of Supabase, you need to:
backup.error.accessTokenInstructions: To create a full backup of Supabase, you need to:
backup.error.accessTokenStep1: 1. Get Personal Access Token from Supabase
backup.error.postgresMajorInstructions: Set SUPABASE_POSTGRES_MAJOR to your project's Postgres major (e.g. 15 or 17).
backup.error.postgresMajorWhereToCheck: You can check it in the Supabase Dashboard: Project Settings -> Infrastructure -> Service Versions (Postgres line).
backup.error.postgresMajorInvalid: SUPABASE_POSTGRES_MAJOR is invalid. Use an integer (e.g. 15 or 17).
backup.steps.storage.credentialsNotAvail: Supabase credentials not available. Backing up metadata only...
backup.steps.roles.exportError: Error exporting Custom Roles via Docker: {message}
backup.steps.functions.preserving: Preserving {count} existing function(s) in supabase/functions folder.
backup.steps.migrations.downloading: Downloading all migrations from server using migration fetch...
backup.steps.migrations.fetchTip: Verify that the project is correctly linked and the token is valid.
restore.steps.components.edgeFunctions.d: Edge Functions will be copied to supabase/functions and deployed to the target project.
The supabase/functions folder will be cleaned before the process.
restore.steps.components.edgeFunctions.i: Do you want to restore Edge Functions
restore.steps.components.auth.title: Auth Settings:
restore.steps.components.auth.descriptio: Auth settings will be displayed for manual configuration in the Dashboard.
Some settings cannot be applied automatically for security reasons.
restore.steps.components.auth.include: Do you want to restore Auth
restore.steps.components.storage.title: Storage:
restore.steps.components.storage.withZip: Buckets and files will be automatically restored to the target project.
The ZIP file will be extracted, buckets created and files uploaded via API.
restore.steps.components.storage.metadat: To restore files, the .storage.zip file from the Dashboard is required.
Only bucket information will be displayed.
restore.steps.components.storage.include: Do you want to restore Storage
restore.steps.components.databaseSetting: Database extensions and settings will be restored via SQL.
This includes PostgreSQL extensions and project-specific settings.
Do you want to restore Database Settings
restore.steps.components.realtime.title: Realtime Settings:
restore.steps.components.realtime.descri: Realtime settings will be displayed for manual configuration in the Dashboard.
Some settings need to be applied manually.
restore.steps.components.realtime.includ: Do you want to restore Realtime
restore.steps.components.database.includ: Do you want to restore Database
restore.steps.database.warning: WARNING: Errors like "object already exists" are EXPECTED
restore.steps.database.warningReason1: This happens because the backup contains CREATE for all schemas
restore.steps.database.warningReason2: Supabase already has auth and storage created, so these errors are normal
restore.steps.database.normalErrors: "already exists" errors are normal and do not affect the restore
restore.steps.database.expectedErrors: Expected errors found (as per Supabase documentation)
restore.steps.database.errorsIgnored: Errors are ignored as they are CREATE commands that already exist
restore.steps.storage.noBuckets: No Storage buckets found in backup
restore.steps.storage.zipRequired: To restore files, the .storage.zip file from the Dashboard is required
restore.steps.storage.noBucketsInBackup: No Storage buckets found in backup
restore.steps.storage.projectIdNotFound: Source project Project ID not found in manifest. Continuing without replacement...
restore.steps.storage.replacing: Replacing references to old Project ID in extracted files...
restore.steps.storage.restoreComplete: Storage restore completed: {success}/{total} bucket(s) processed, {files} file(s) uploaded
restore.steps.storage.noBucketsInSubfold: Error: No buckets found in subfolders of {rootDir}
restore.steps.storage.rootIsProjectId: The root folder is a Project ID and should not be treated as a bucket
restore.steps.storage.updating: Updating bucket settings to match backup...
restore.steps.storage.detectedProjectId: Detected root folder with Project ID: {projectId}{reason}
restore.steps.edgeFunctions.notFound: No Edge Functions found in backup
restore.steps.auth.notFound: No Auth settings found in backup
restore.steps.auth.pressEnter: After configuring, press Enter to continue...
restore.steps.databaseSettings.notFound: No Database settings found in backup
restore.steps.databaseSettings.extension: {extName} - extension already exists or cannot be enabled
restore.steps.realtime.notFound: No Realtime settings found in backup
restore.steps.realtime.pressEnter: After configuring, press Enter to continue...
restore.steps.backupSelection.title: Available backups:
restore.steps.backupSelection.input: Enter the backup number to restore ({min}-{max}):
utils.realtime.previousFound: A previous Realtime Settings recording was found.
utils.realtime.reuse: Do you want to reuse the previous configurations?
utils.realtime.reusing: Reusing Realtime Settings configurations from previous backup...
utils.realtime.note: Note the values of the 7 parameters below:
utils.realtime.questions: Answer the questions below (press Enter to use default value):
utils.realtime.copying: Copying Realtime Settings from previous backup...
utils.supabaseLink.validationFailed: Validation failed: linked-ref = {linkedRef} (expected = {expected}). The linked project does not match the expected project.
restore.index.envUpdated: .env.local updated successfully. No keys renamed; values synchronized.
restore.index.confirmRestore: Do you want to start the restoration with these configurations?
restore.disclaimer.errorsIntro: During the database restore you will see many error messages in the terminal. This is NORMAL and expected.
restore.disclaimer.errorsReason: Supabase confirms that errors like "object already exists" or "constraint already exists" are normal when restoring a full dump, because the backup contains CREATE commands for all schemas and your target project already has some of these objects.
restore.disclaimer.supabaseDoc: Official Supabase documentation (restore and expected errors):
restore.disclaimer.waitComplete: Even with numerous errors, you must wait for the process to complete fully. Do not interrupt the restore.
restore.disclaimer.testResult: After completion, test your project (tables, data, functions) to verify whether the restore succeeded.
restore.disclaimer.acceptProceed: I understand that errors are expected, I will wait for completion and I will test the result. Proceed with restore?
restore.index.authSettingsRestored: Auth Settings: Settings displayed for manual configuration
restore.index.storageMetadataOnly: Storage: {buckets} bucket(s) found - metadata only (.storage.zip file not found)
restore.index.databaseSettingsRestored: Database Settings: Extensions and settings restored via SQL
restore.index.realtimeSettingsRestored: Realtime Settings: Settings displayed for manual configuration

restore.utils.storageBuckets: Storage Buckets: Automatic restoration of buckets and files via API

restore.utils.databaseSettings: Database Extensions and Settings: Restore via SQL
restore.utils.realtimeSettings: Realtime Settings: Display URL and values for manual configuration

restore.import.cannotFind: Could not find the imported backup
